name: Ansible Lockdown
description: Curated collection of information security themed Ansible roles that are both vetted and actively maintained.

name: Clevis
description: Plugable framework for automated decryption, often used as a Tang client.

name: DShell
description: Extensible network forensic analysis framework written in Python that enables rapid development of plugins to support the dissection of network packet captures.

name: Dev-Sec.io
description: Server hardening framework providing Ansible, Chef, and Puppet implementations of various baseline security configurations.

name: peepdf
description: Scriptable PDF file analyzer.

name: PyREBox
description: Python-scriptable reverse engineering sandbox, based on QEMU.

name: Watchtower
description: Container-based solution for automating Docker container base image updates, providing an unattended upgrade experience.

name: MultiScanner
description: File analysis framework written in Python that assists in evaluating a set of files by automatically running a suite of tools against them and aggregating the output.

name: Posh-VirusTotal
description: PowerShell interface to VirusTotal.com APIs.

name: censys-python
description: Python wrapper to the Censys REST API.

name: libcrafter
description: High level C++ network packet sniffing and crafting library.

name: python-dshield
description: Pythonic interface to the Internet Storm Center/DShield API.

name: python-sandboxapi
description: Minimal, consistent Python API for building integrations with malware sandboxes.

name: python-stix2
description: Python APIs for serializing and de-serializing Structured Threat Information eXpression (STIX) JSON content, plus higher-level APIs for common tasks.

name: Shuffle
description: Graphical generalized workflow (automation) builder for IT professionals and blue teamers.

name: Aaia
description: Helps in visualizing AWS IAM and Organizations in a graph format with help of Neo4j.

name: Falco
description: Behavioral activity monitor designed to detect anomalous activity in containerized applications, hosts, and network packet flows by auditing the Linux kernel and enriched by runtime data such as Kubernetes metrics.

name: Kata Containers
description: Secure container runtime with lightweight virtual machines that feel and perform like containers, but provide stronger workload isolation using hardware virtualization technology as a second layer of defense.

name: Principal Mapper (PMapper)
description: Quickly evaluate IAM permissions in AWS via script and library capable of identifying risks in the configuration of AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) for an AWS account or an AWS organization.

name: Prowler
description: Tool based on AWS-CLI commands for Amazon Web Services account security assessment and hardening.

name: Scout Suite
description: Open source multi-cloud security-auditing tool, which enables security posture assessment of cloud environments.

name: gVisor
description: Application kernel, written in Go, that implements a substantial portion of the Linux system surface to provide an isolation boundary between the application and the host kernel.

name: Cortex
description: Provides horizontally scalable, highly available, multi-tenant, long term storage for Prometheus.

name: Jaeger
description: Distributed tracing platform backend used for monitoring and troubleshooting microservices-based distributed systems.

name: OpenTelemetry
description: Observability framework for cloud-native software, comprising a collection of tools, APIs, and SDKs for exporting application performance metrics to a tracing backend (formerly maintained by the OpenTracing and OpenCensus projects).

name: Prometheus
description: Open-source systems monitoring and alerting toolkit originally built at SoundCloud.

name: Zipkin
description: Distributed tracing system backend that helps gather timing data needed to troubleshoot latency problems in service architectures.

name: KubeSec
description: Static analyzer of Kubernetes manifests that can be run locally, as a Kuberenetes admission controller, or as its own cloud service.

name: Kyverno
description: Policy engine designed for Kubernetes.

name: Linkerd
description: Ultra light Kubernetes-specific service mesh that adds observability, reliability, and security to Kubernetes applications without requiring any modification of the application itself.

name: Managed Kubernetes Inspection Tool (MKIT)
description: Query and validate several common security-related configuration settings of managed Kubernetes cluster objects and the workloads/resources running inside the cluster.

name: Polaris
description: Validates Kubernetes best practices by running tests against code commits, a Kubernetes admission request, or live resources already running in a cluster.

name: Sealed Secrets
description: Kubernetes controller and tool for one-way encrypted Secrets.

name: certificate-expiry-monitor
description: Utility that exposes the expiry of TLS certificates as Prometheus metrics.

name: k-rail
description: Workload policy enforcement tool for Kubernetes.

name: kube-forensics
description: Allows a cluster administrator to dump the current state of a running pod and all its containers so that security professionals can perform off-line forensic analysis.

name: kube-hunter
description: Open-source tool that runs a set of tests ("hunters") for security issues in Kubernetes clusters from either outside ("attacker's view") or inside a cluster.

name: kubernetes-event-exporter
description: Allows exporting the often missed Kubernetes events to various outputs so that they can be used for observability or alerting purposes.

name: Consul
description: Solution to connect and configure applications across dynamic, distributed infrastructure and, with Consul Connect, enabling secure service-to-service communication with automatic TLS encryption and identity-based authorization.

name: Istio
description: Open platform for providing a uniform way to integrate microservices, manage traffic flow across microservices, enforce policies and aggregate telemetry data.

name: GPG Sync
description: Centralize and automate OpenPGP public key distribution, revocation, and updates amongst all members of an organization or team.

name: Geneva (Genetic Evasion)
description: Novel experimental genetic algorithm that evolves packet-manipulation-based censorship evasion strategies against nation-state level censors to increase availability of otherwise blocked content.

name: GlobaLeaks
description: Free, open source software enabling anyone to easily set up and maintain a secure whistleblowing platform.

name: SecureDrop
description: Open source whistleblower submission system that media organizations and NGOs can install to securely accept documents from anonymous sources.

name: Teleport
description: Allows engineers and security professionals to unify access for SSH servers, Kubernetes clusters, web applications, and databases across all environments.

name: Bane
description: Custom and better AppArmor profile generator for Docker containers.

name: BlackBox
description: Safely store secrets in Git/Mercurial/Subversion by encrypting them "at rest" using GnuPG.

name: Checkov
description: Static analysis for Terraform (infrastructure as code) to help detect CIS policy violations and prevent cloud security misconfiguration.

name: Cilium
description: Open source software for transparently securing the network connectivity between application services deployed using Linux container management platforms like Docker and Kubernetes.

name: Clair
description: Static analysis tool to probe for vulnerabilities introduced via application container (e.g., Docker) images.

name: CodeQL
description: Discover vulnerabilities across a codebase by performing queries against code as though it were data.

name: DefectDojo
description: Application vulnerability management tool built for DevOps and continuous security integration.

name: Gauntlt
description: Pentest applications during routine continuous integration build pipelines.

name: Git Secrets
description: Prevents you from committing passwords and other sensitive information to a git repository.

name: SOPS
description: Editor of encrypted files that supports YAML, JSON, ENV, INI and binary formats and encrypts with AWS KMS, GCP KMS, Azure Key Vault, and PGP.

name: Snyk
description: Finds and fixes vulnerabilities and license violations in open source dependencies and container images.

name: SonarQube
description: Continuous inspection tool that provides detailed reports during automated testing and alerts on newly introduced security vulnerabilities.

name: Trivy
description: Simple and comprehensive vulnerability scanner for containers and other artifacts, suitable for use in continuous integration pipelines.

name: Vault
description: Tool for securely accessing secrets such as API keys, passwords, or certificates through a unified interface.

name: git-crypt
description: Transparent file encryption in git; files which you choose to protect are encrypted when committed, and decrypted when checked out.

name: helm-secrets
description: Helm plugin that helps manage secrets with Git workflow and stores them anywhere, backed by SOPS.

name: terrascan
description: Static code analyzer for Infrastructure as Code tools that helps detect compliance and security violations to mitigate risk before provisioning cloud native resources.

name: tfsec
description: Static analysis security scanner for your Terraform code designed to run locally and in CI pipelines.

name: DynInst
description: Tools for binary instrumentation, analysis, and modification, useful for binary patching.

name: DynamoRIO
description: Runtime code manipulation system that supports code transformations on any part of a program, while it executes, implemented as a process-level virtual machine.

name: Egalito
description: Binary recompiler and instrumentation framework that can fully disassemble, transform, and regenerate ordinary Linux binaries designed for binary hardening and security research.

name: Valgrind
description: Instrumentation framework for building dynamic analysis tools.

name: Chef InSpec
description: Language for describing security and compliance rules, which become automated tests that can be run against IT infrastructures to discover and report on non-compliance.

name: OpenSCAP Base
description: Both a library and a command line tool (oscap) used to evaluate a system against SCAP baseline profiles to report on the security posture of the scanned system(s).

name: Dependency Combobulator
description: Open source, modular and extensible framework to detect and prevent dependency confusion leakage and potential attacks.

name: Confusion checker
description: Script to check if you have artifacts containing the same name between your repositories.

name: snync
description: Prevent and detect if you're vulnerable to dependency confusion supply chain security attacks.

name: Atheris
description: Coverage-guided Python fuzzing engine based off of libFuzzer that supports fuzzing of Python code but also native extensions written for CPython.

name: FuzzBench
description: Free service that evaluates fuzzers on a wide variety of real-world benchmarks, at Google scale.

name: OneFuzz
description: Self-hosted Fuzzing-as-a-Service (FaaS) platform.

name: AllStar
description: GitHub App installed on organizations or repositories to set and enforce security policies.

name: Conftest
description: Utility to help you write tests against structured configuration data.

name: Open Policy Agent (OPA)
description: Unified toolset and framework for policy across the cloud native stack.

name: Tang
description: Server for binding data to network presence; provides data to clients only when they are on a certain (secured) network.

name: Grafeas
description: Open artifact metadata API to audit and govern your software supply chain.

name: Helm GPG (GnuPG) Plugin
description: Chart signing and verification with GnuPG for Helm.

name: Notary
description: Aims to make the internet more secure by making it easy for people to publish and verify content.

name: in-toto
description: Framework to secure the integrity of software supply chains.

name: CanaryTokens
description: Self-hostable honeytoken generator and reporting dashboard; demo version available at CanaryTokens.org.

name: Kushtaka
description: Sustainable all-in-one honeypot and honeytoken orchestrator for under-resourced blue teams.

name: Manuka
description: Open-sources intelligence (OSINT) honeypot that monitors reconnaissance attempts by threat actors and generates actionable intelligence for Blue Teamers.

name: Endlessh
description: SSH tarpit that slowly sends an endless banner.

name: LaBrea
description: Program that answers ARP requests for unused IP space, creating the appearance of fake machines that answer further requests very slowly in order to slow down scanners, worms, etcetera.

name: Artillery
description: Combination honeypot, filesystem monitor, and alerting system designed to protect Linux and Windows operating systems.

name: chkrootkit
description: Locally checks for signs of a rootkit on GNU/Linux systems.

name: Crowd Inspect
description: Free tool for Windows systems aimed to alert you to the presence of malware that may be communicating over the network.

name: Fail2ban
description: Intrusion prevention software framework that protects computer servers from brute-force attacks.

name: Open Source HIDS SECurity (OSSEC)
description: Fully open source and free, feature-rich, Host-based Instrusion Detection System (HIDS).

name: Rootkit Hunter (rkhunter)
description: POSIX-compliant Bash script that scans a host for various signs of malware.

name: Bubblewrap
description: Sandboxing tool for use by unprivileged Linux users capable of restricting access to parts of the operating system or user data.

name: Dangerzone
description: Take potentially dangerous PDFs, office documents, or images and convert them to a safe PDF.

name: Firejail
description: SUID program that reduces the risk of security breaches by restricting the running environment of untrusted applications using Linux namespaces and seccomp-bpf.

name: Gluu Server
description: Central authentication and authorization for Web and mobile applications with a Free and Open Source Software cloud-native community distribution.

name: LogonTracer
description: Investigate malicious Windows logon by visualizing and analyzing Windows event log.

name: Volatility
description: Advanced memory forensics framework.

name: aws_ir
description: Automates your incident response with zero security preparedness assumptions.

name: CIRTKit
description: Scriptable Digital Forensics and Incident Response (DFIR) toolkit built on Viper.

name: Fast Incident Response (FIR)
description: Cybersecurity incident management platform allowing for easy creation, tracking, and reporting of cybersecurity incidents.

name: Rekall
description: Advanced forensic and incident response framework.

name: TheHive
description: Scalable, free Security Incident Response Platform designed to make life easier for SOCs, CSIRTs, and CERTs, featuring tight integration with MISP.

name: threat_note
description: Web application built by Defense Point Security to allow security researchers the ability to add and retrieve indicators related to their research.

name: AutoMacTC
description: Modular, automated forensic triage collection framework designed to access various forensic artifacts on macOS, parse them, and present them in formats viable for analysis.

name: OSXAuditor
description: Free macOS computer forensics tool.

name: OSXCollector
description: Forensic evidence collection & analysis toolkit for macOS.

name: ir-rescue
description: Windows Batch script and a Unix Bash script to comprehensively collect host forensic data during incident response.

name: Margarita Shotgun
description: Command line utility (that works with or without Amazon EC2 instances) to parallelize remote memory acquisition.

name: Gatekeeper
description: First open source Distributed Denial of Service (DDoS) protection system.

name: fwknop
description: Protects ports via Single Packet Authorization in your firewall.

name: ssh-audit
description: Simple tool that makes quick recommendations for improving an SSH server's security posture.

name: IPFire
description: Hardened GNU/Linux based router and firewall distribution forked from IPCop.

name: OPNsense
description: Hardened FreeBSD based firewall and routing platform forked from pfSense.

name: pfSense
description: FreeBSD firewall and router distribution forked from m0n0wall.

name: Computer Aided Investigative Environment (CAINE)
description: Italian GNU/Linux live distribution that pre-packages numerous digital forensics and evidence collection tools.

name: Security Onion
description: Free and open source GNU/Linux distribution for intrusion detection, enterprise security monitoring, and log management.

name: Qubes OS
description: Desktop environment built atop the Xen hypervisor project that runs each end-user program in its own virtual machine intended to provide strict security controls to constrain the reach of any successful malware exploit.

name: CertSpotter
description: Certificate Transparency log monitor from SSLMate that alerts you when a SSL/TLS certificate is issued for one of your domains.

name: Gophish
description: Powerful, open-source phishing framework that makes it easy to test your organization's exposure to phishing.

name: King Phisher
description: Tool for testing and promoting user awareness by simulating real world phishing attacks.

name: NotifySecurity
description: Outlook add-in used to help your users to report suspicious e-mails to security teams.

name: Phishing Intelligence Engine (PIE)
description: Framework that will assist with the detection and response to phishing attacks.

name: Swordphish
description: Platform allowing to create and manage (fake) phishing campaigns intended to train people in identifying suspicious mails.

name: mailspoof
description: Scans SPF and DMARC records for issues that could allow email spoofing.

name: phishing_catcher
description: Configurable script to watch for issuances of suspicious TLS certificates by domain name in the Certificate Transparency Log (CTL) using the CertStream service.

name: APTSimulator
description: Toolset to make a system look as if it was the victim of an APT attack.

name: Atomic Red Team
description: Library of simple, automatable tests to execute for testing security controls.

name: BadBlood
description: Fills a test (non-production) Windows Domain with data that enables security analysts and engineers to practice using tools to gain an understanding and prescribe to securing Active Directory.

name: Caldera
description: Scalable, automated, and extensible adversary emulation platform developed by MITRE.

name: Drool
description: Replay DNS traffic from packet capture files and send it to a specified server, such as for simulating DDoS attacks on the DNS and measuring normal DNS querying.

name: DumpsterFire
description: Modular, menu-driven, cross-platform tool for building repeatable, time-delayed, distributed security events for Blue Team drills and sensor/alert mapping.

name: Infection Monkey
description: Open-source breach and attack simulation (BAS) platform that helps you validate existing controls and identify how attackers might exploit your current network security gaps.

name: Metta
description: Automated information security preparedness tool to do adversarial simulation.

name: Network Flight Simulator (flightsim)
description: Utility to generate malicious network traffic and help security teams evaluate security controls and audit their network visibility.

name: RedHunt OS
description: Ubuntu-based Open Virtual Appliance (.ova) preconfigured with several threat emulation tools as well as a defender's toolkit.

name: Bunkerized-nginx
description: Docker image of an NginX configuration and scripts implementing many defensive techniques for Web sites.

name: Starbase
description: Collects assets and relationships from services and systems into an intuitive graph view to offer graph-based security analysis for everyone.

name: Wazuh
description: Open source, multiplatform agent-based security monitoring based on a fork of OSSEC HIDS.

name: ChopShop
description: Framework to aid analysts in the creation and execution of pynids-based decoders and detectors of APT tradecraft.

name: Maltrail
description: Malicious network traffic detection system.

name: Moloch
description: Augments your current security infrastructure to store and index network traffic in standard PCAP format, providing fast, indexed access.

name: OwlH
description: Helps manage network IDS at scale by visualizing Suricata, Zeek, and Moloch life cycles.

name: Real Intelligence Threat Analysis (RITA)
description: Open source framework for network traffic analysis that ingests Zeek logs and detects beaconing, DNS tunneling, and more.

name: Respounder
description: Detects the presence of the Responder LLMNR/NBT-NS/MDNS poisoner on a network.

name: Snort
description: Widely-deployed, Free Software IPS capable of real-time packet analysis, traffic logging, and custom rule-based triggers.

name: SpoofSpotter
description: Catch spoofed NetBIOS Name Service (NBNS) responses and alert to an email or log file.

name: Stenographer
description: Full-packet-capture utility for buffering packets to disk for intrusion detection and incident response purposes.

name: Suricata
description: Free, cross-platform, IDS/IPS with on- and off-line analysis modes and deep packet inspection capabilities that is also scriptable with Lua.

name: Tsunami
description: General purpose network security scanner with an extensible plugin system for detecting high severity vulnerabilities with high confidence.

name: VAST
description: Free and open-source network telemetry engine for data-driven security investigations.

name: Wireshark
description: Free and open-source packet analyzer useful for network troubleshooting or forensic netflow analysis.

name: Zeek
description: Powerful network analysis framework focused on security monitoring, formerly known as Bro.

name: netsniff-ng
description: Free and fast GNU/Linux networking toolkit with numerous utilities such as a connection tracking tool (flowtop), traffic generator (trafgen), and autonomous system (AS) trace route utility (astraceroute).

name: AlienVault OSSIM
description: Single-server open source SIEM platform featuring asset discovery, asset inventorying, behavioral monitoring, and event correlation, driven by AlienVault Open Threat Exchange (OTX).

name: Prelude SIEM OSS
description: Open source, agentless SIEM with a long history and several commercial variants featuring security event collection, normalization, and alerting from arbitrary log input and numerous popular monitoring tools.

name: Icinga
description: Modular redesign of Nagios with pluggable user interfaces and an expanded set of data connectors, collectors, and reporting tools.

name: Locust
description: Open source load testing tool in which you can define user behaviour with Python code and swarm your system with millions of simultaneous users.

name: Nagios
description: Popular network and service monitoring solution and reporting platform.

name: OpenNMS
description: Free and feature-rich networking monitoring system supporting multiple configurations, a variety of alerting mechanisms (email, XMPP, SMS), and numerous data collection methods (SNMP, HTTP, JDBC, etc).

name: osquery
description: Operating system instrumentation framework for macOS, Windows, and Linux, exposing the OS as a high-performance relational database that can be queried with a SQL-like syntax.

name: Zabbix
description: Mature, enterprise-level platform to monitor large-scale IT environments.

name: CimSweep
description: Suite of CIM/WMI-based tools enabling remote incident response and hunting operations across all versions of Windows.

name: DeepBlueCLI
description: PowerShell module for hunt teaming via Windows Event logs.

name: GRR Rapid Response
description: Incident response framework focused on remote live forensics consisting of a Python agent installed on assets and Python-based server infrastructure enabling analysts to quickly triage attacks and perform analysis remotely.

name: Hunting ELK (HELK)
description: All-in-one Free Software threat hunting stack based on Elasticsearch, Logstash, Kafka, and Kibana with various built-in integrations for analytics including Jupyter Notebook.

name: MozDef
description: Automate the security incident handling process and facilitate the real-time activities of incident handlers.

name: PSHunt
description: PowerShell module designed to scan remote endpoints for indicators of compromise or survey them for more comprehensive information related to state of those systems.

name: PSRecon
description: PSHunt-like tool for analyzing remote Windows systems that also produces a self-contained HTML report of its findings.

name: PowerForensics
description: All in one PowerShell-based platform to perform live hard disk forensic analysis.

name: rastrea2r
description: Multi-platform tool for triaging suspected IOCs on many endpoints simultaneously and that integrates with antivirus consoles.

name: Redline
description: Freeware endpoint auditing and analysis tool that provides host-based investigative capabilities, offered by FireEye, Inc.

name: AttackerKB
description: Free and public crowdsourced vulnerability assessment platform to help prioritize high-risk patch application and combat vulnerability fatigue.

name: DATA
description: Credential phish analysis and automation tool that can accept suspected phishing URLs directly or trigger on observed network traffic containing such a URL.

name: Forager
description: Multi-threaded threat intelligence gathering built with Python3 featuring simple text-based configuration and data storage for ease of use and data portability.

name: GRASSMARLIN
description: Provides IP network situational awareness of industrial control systems (ICS) and Supervisory Control and Data Acquisition (SCADA) by passively mapping, accounting for, and reporting on your ICS/SCADA network topology and endpoints.

name: MLSec Combine
description: Gather and combine multiple threat intelligence feed sources into one customizable, standardized CSV-based format.

name: Malware Information Sharing Platform and Threat Sharing (MISP)
description: Open source software solution for collecting, storing, distributing and sharing cyber security indicators.

name: Open Source Vulnerabilities (OSV)
description: Vulnerability database and triage infrastructure for open source projects aimed at helping both open source maintainers and consumers of open source.

name: Sigma
description: Generic signature format for SIEM systems, offering an open signature format that allows you to describe relevant log events in a straightforward manner.

name: Threat Bus
description: Threat intelligence dissemination layer to connect security tools through a distributed publish/subscribe message broker.

name: ThreatIngestor
description: Extendable tool to extract and aggregate IOCs from threat feeds including Twitter, RSS feeds, or other sources.

name: Unfetter
description: Identifies defensive gaps in security posture by leveraging Mitre's ATT&CK framework.

name: Viper
description: Binary analysis and management framework enabling easy organization of malware and exploit samples.

name: YARA
description: Tool aimed at (but not limited to) helping malware researchers to identify and classify malware samples, described as "the pattern matching swiss army knife" for file patterns and signatures.

name: HASSH
description: Network fingerprinting standard which can be used to identify specific client and server SSH implementations.

name: JA3
description: Extracts SSL/TLS handshake settings for fingerprinting and communicating about a given TLS implementation.

name: ESET's Malware IoCs
description: Indicators of Compromises (IOCs) derived from ESET's various investigations.

name: FireEye's Red Team Tool Countermeasures
description: Collection of Snort and YARA rules to detect attacks carried out with FireEye's own Red Team tools, first released after FireEye disclosed a breach in December 2020.

name: FireEye's Sunburst Countermeasures
description: Collection of IoC in various languages for detecting backdoored SolarWinds Orion NMS activities and related vulnerabilities.

name: YARA Rules
description: Project covering the need for IT security researchers to have a single repository where different Yara signatures are compiled, classified and kept as up to date as possible.

name: OnionBalance
description: Provides load-balancing while also making Onion services more resilient and reliable by eliminating single points-of-failure.

name: Vanguards
description: Version 3 Onion service guard discovery attack mitigation script (intended for eventual inclusion in Tor core).

name: Certbot
description: Free tool to automate the issuance and renewal of TLS certificates from the LetsEncrypt Root CA with plugins that configure various Web and e-mail server software.

name: MITMEngine
description: Golang library for server-side detection of TLS interception events.

name: Tor
description: Censorship circumvention and anonymizing overlay network providing distributed, cryptographically verified name services (.onion domains) to enhance publisher privacy and service availability.

name: IPsec VPN Server Auto Setup Scripts
description: Scripts to build your own IPsec VPN server, with IPsec/L2TP, Cisco IPsec and IKEv2.

name: Innernet
description: Free Software private network system that uses WireGuard under the hood, made to be self-hosted.

name: Nebula
description: Completely open source and self-hosted, scalable overlay networking tool with a focus on performance, simplicity, and security, inspired by tinc.

name: OpenVPN
description: Longstanding Free Software traditional SSL/TLS-based virtual private network.

name: OpenZITI
description: Open source initiative focused on bringing Zero Trust to any application via an overlay network, tunelling applications, and numerous SDKs.

name: Tailscale
description: Managed freemium mesh VPN service built on top of WireGuard.

name: WireGuard
description: Extremely simple yet fast and modern VPN that utilizes state-of-the-art cryptography.

name: tinc
description: Free Software mesh VPN implemented entirely in userspace that supports expandable network space, bridged ethernet segments, and more.

name: BlockBlock
description: Monitors common persistence locations and alerts whenever a persistent component is added, which helps to detect and prevent malware installation.

name: LuLu
description: Free macOS firewall.

name: Santa
description: Keep track of binaries that are naughty or nice in an allow/deny-listing system for macOS.

name: Stronghold
description: Easily configure macOS security settings from the terminal.

name: macOS Fortress
description: Automated configuration of kernel-level, OS-level, and client-level security features including privatizing proxying and anti-virus scanning for macOS.

name: CobaltStrikeScan
description: Scan files or process memory for Cobalt Strike beacons and parse their configuration.

name: HardenTools
description: Utility that disables a number of risky Windows features.

name: NotRuler
description: Detect both client-side rules and VBScript enabled forms used by the Ruler attack tool when attempting to compromise a Microsoft Exchange server.

name: Sandboxie
description: Free and open source general purpose Windows application sandboxing utility.

name: Sigcheck
description: Audit a Windows host's root certificate store against Microsoft's Certificate Trust List (CTL).

name: Sticky Keys Slayer
description: Establishes a Windows RDP session from a list of hostnames and scans for accessibility tools backdoors, alerting if one is discovered.

name: Windows Secure Host Baseline
description: Group Policy objects, compliance checks, and configuration tools that provide an automated and flexible approach for securely deploying and maintaining the latest releases of Windows 10.

name: WMI Monitor
description: Log newly created WMI consumers and processes to the Windows Application event log.

name: Active Directory Control Paths
description: Visualize and graph Active Directory permission configs ("control relations") to audit questions such as "Who can read the CEO's email?" and similar.

name: PingCastle
description: Active Directory vulnerability detection and reporting tool.

name: PlumHound
description: More effectively use BloodHoundAD in continual security life-cycles by utilizing its pathfinding engine to identify Active Directory security vulnerabilities.
